title: RAW VIDEO | Juvenile arrested in fatal shooting of 15-year-old boy
content:
LOUISVILLE, Ky. (WDRB) -- Louisville Metro Police say they've arrested a juvenile for the fatal shooting of a 15-year-old boy earlier this month.
The victim, Le Truong, died at University Hospital from a gunshot wound to the stomach around 7 p.m. on Nov. 10, less than an hour after he was found shot in the 4900 block of S. First Street near Tenny Avenue.
WDRB has confirmed that Le Truong was a student at Iroquois High School. Grief counselors were called in to the school.
According to the Louisville Metro Police Facebook page, Louisville Metro Police stopped a stolen car last night, Thursday, Nov. 17, around 11 p.m. in the area of Wabash Court. Police say the car matched a description in a wanted poster.
Police say they interviewed one of the occupants of the car -- a juvenile -- and charged that person with the murder of Le Truong.
The name of the suspect is being withheld due to the fact that the person in question is a juvenile.
